link_mentions.page: List of Moderators of the General Assembly of the Church of Scotland
response: *1917 James Cooper (Professor of Church History, Glasgow)
The Scottish Church Society is a Church of Scotland society founded in 1892. Leading founders were Thomas Leishman and William Milligan, and the first secretary was James Cooper.

From 1887 to 1918 he was minister of Bellahouston Church in Glasgow. In 1916 he replaced David Paul as Moderator of the General Assembly of the Church of Scotland, and he was replaced in turn in 1917 by James Cooper.Fasti ecclesiae scoticanae: the succession of ministers in the Church of Scotland from the reformation , Vol. III, page 396
